result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Arlen Anderson III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard Arlen Anderson III is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard Arlen Anderson III was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Endanger Safety (2nd+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(2).
  • Richard Arlen Anderson III was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer (subd. 2 - 0.20 to 0.249)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Eric J. Lundell February 18, 2016 - should be 346.65(2)(g) subd. 2 - 0.20 to 0.249.

Court dismisses Count 3.
Probation to meet with Defendant before release from Jail to help schedule.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to meet with payment clerk before release to set up a payment plan.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Richard Arlen Anderson appeared from jail.  Court called.  Set for Motion Hearing.  Attorney Kucinski recites the agreement.  State moves to amend Ct. 1 to 346.62 (Reckless Driving).  Crt questions the DE.  DE pleads No Contest to the amended.  Crt enters a No Contest plea on the ameded Ct. 1.  Crt finds the DE adjudicated Guilty of the amended.  Crt orders a F/F of $389.50 for Ct. 1 in 15CF573.  Crt proceeds with Ct. 2 in 15CF573.   Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 2 in 15CF573.  Crt enters a No Contest plea. Crt Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF573. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 3 in 15CF573 & 15CM662 & Citation No B257089-0, B257081-6 & B257090-1.   Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  Crt orders:

Ct 2 in 15CF573
- W/S 2 years probation with conditions
- 60 days in the St. Croix County Jail with credit for good time
- 37 days credit for time served
- AODA and follow up with any recommended therapy or treatment
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion by the probation agent or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
- 24 months driver's license revocation
- 24 months IID
- F/F of $1,744.00 
- DE to meet with payment clerk before release to set up a payment plan for Ct. 2 F/F $1,744.00 and amended Ct. 1 F/F $389.50
- Probation to meet with the DE before release.  Jail to help schedule
- 20 days to appeal
filed by ADA M. Nieskes. gme
Motion hearing at 01-19-2016 01:00 pm

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Richard Arlen Anderson appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:25 p.m.  Set for arraignment.  Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Not guilty pleas are entered.   Speedy trial is demanded.   Set out for Motion Hearing.  Bail is continued.  Court adjourned at 3:29 p.m. lw  Motion hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
